media:group.media:title: Pythagorean intervals in music and the magic of numbers | Maths and Music | N J Wildberger
media:group.media:description:
Let's introduce the remarkable connection that the ancient Greeks, in the school of Pythagoras, discovered between ratios or proportions between small natural numbers and pleasant sounding harmonic intervals.

The relation is perhaps best introduced by discussing notes on a guitar string, and applying some affine geometry (not metrical, or Euclidean!)

However we need to realize that all is not quite so pleasant mathematically as the Pythagoreans would have liked, as such a tuning system ends up having some inconsistencies when we try to translate from one key to another. This is an obstacle that generated a huge amount of analysis in the history of Western music -- and we will be discussing this in our next video.

This video is one in a series where we look at the foundations of music from a mathematical point of view, and is complemented by my Tik Tok channel www.tiktok.com/@njwildberger .
